ByÅ‚o to pokrzepiajÄ…ce, Å¼e mimo mojego awangardowego stylu pisania, rÃ³wnieÅ¼ i ja byÅ‚em w stanie siÄ™ nauczyÄ‡ jak pisaÄ‡ na plakatach dostatecznie wyraÅºnie.

Przez dÅ‚uÅ¼szy czas nie tykaÅ‚em flamastra, aÅ¼ pewnego piÄ™knego dnia stwierdziÅ‚em, Å¼e wyprÃ³bujÄ™ te umiejÄ™tnoÅ›ci w codziennej praktyce speca od dokumentacji i autora radosnej twÃ³rczoÅ›ci po godzinach. PoszerzyÅ‚em mÃ³j zestaw pisakÃ³w, zakupiÅ‚em biuwar (moje nowe ulubione sÅ‚owo ğŸ˜‰) i zaczÄ…Å‚em eksperymenty z pisanymi i rysowanymi notatkami. Dla mniej zorientowanych, biuwar to duÅ¼y arkusz papieru z kalendarzem, miejscem na odrÄ™czne rysunki i listÄ™ zadaÅ„.

Jak korzystam z wizualnych notatekâ€‹

ZapisujÄ™ sobie gÅ‚Ã³wne tagi, ktÃ³rymi kategoryzujÄ™ notatki w narzÄ™dziu Obsidian. Postaram siÄ™ napisaÄ‡ wiÄ™cej o tej aplikacji w jednym z moich przyszÅ‚ych artykuÅ‚Ã³w.

Rysunki "pÄ…czkujÄ…" i z biegiem czasu tworzy siÄ™ z nich mozaika. JeÅ›li tematy znajdujÄ… siÄ™ blisko siebie, oznacza to, Å¼e sÄ… w jakiÅ› sposÃ³b ze sobÄ… zwiÄ…zane. Za pomocÄ… kolorÃ³w i innych metod mogÄ™ podkreÅ›laÄ‡ powiÄ…zane tematy. Z luboÅ›ciÄ… wykreÅ›lam zamkniÄ™te sprawy. Kiedy na arkuszu robi siÄ™ zbyt tÅ‚oczno albo wiÄ™kszoÅ›Ä‡ kwestii jest rozwiÄ…zana, wydzieram kartkÄ™ i biorÄ™ siÄ™ do zapisywania kolejnej. Stare notatki zachowujÄ™, bo stanowiÄ… wizualny zapis stanu rzeczy z danego momentu projektu. Czasem do pewnych szczegÃ³Å‚Ã³w warto wrÃ³ciÄ‡.

Wystarczy na niÄ… spojrzeÄ‡, Å¼eby odÅ›wieÅ¼yÄ‡ sobie kluczowe informacje. Im bardziej zÅ‚oÅ¼ona struktura tego nad czym pracujesz, tym bardziej wizualizacja pomaga Ci uÅ‚oÅ¼yÄ‡ to sobie w gÅ‚owie. Jest to szczegÃ³lnie pomocne podczas etapu analizy. Dodatkowym plusem jest to, Å¼e kiedy masz niezapowiedzianÄ… rozmowÄ™ na Teams na temat danego projektu, masz przed oczami kluczowe fakty. No i oczywiÅ›cie masz miejsce na arkuszu na zrobienie szybkich notatek w trakcie rozmowy. Czasem za status mojego projektu wystarcza zdjÄ™cie rysunku podsumowujÄ…cego moje dziaÅ‚ania. Dlaczego uwaÅ¼am, Å¼e warto notowaÄ‡ i rysowaÄ‡â€‹

Notatki wizualne to doskonaÅ‚e urozmaicenie pracy biurowej, ktÃ³ra polega gÅ‚Ã³wnie na patrzeniu w monitor i klepaniu na klawiaturze. UwaÅ¼am, Å¼e rysowanie jest relaksujÄ…cÄ… i rozwijajÄ…cÄ… czynnoÅ›ciÄ…, ktÃ³ra angaÅ¼uje dodatkowe obszary mÃ³zgu, wspierajÄ…c kreatywnoÅ›Ä‡, wyobraÅºniÄ™ i myÅ›lenie. Najlepsze rzeczy w Å¼yciu sÄ… najprostsze. Jest w tym czysta radoÅ›Ä‡ tworzenia. Nie bez powodu dzieci w wieku przedszkolnym i szkolnym spÄ™dzajÄ… masÄ™ czasu na rysowaniu. JeÅ›li i Ty spÄ™dzisz na tym chociaÅ¼ 15 minut w ciÄ…gu dnia, nie poÅ¼aÅ‚ujesz. OdrÄ™czne notatki to bardzo elastyczna metoda - moÅ¼liwoÅ›ci ekspresji sÄ… ogromne. KÃ³Å‚ko, kreska, przekreÅ›lenie czy falista linia potrafiÄ… w kilka sekund uchwyciÄ‡ wiele ulotnych koncepcji na papierze.

Co na to nauka?â€‹

Nie powinno byÄ‡ zaskoczeniem, Å¼e istniejÄ… badania naukowe wskazujÄ…ce na dobroczynny wpÅ‚yw rysowania na rozwÃ³j dzieci. Dowiedziono rÃ³wnieÅ¼, Å¼e robienie rysowanych notatek czy nawet gryzmolenie na brzegu zeszytu ma pozytywny wpÅ‚yw na koncentracjÄ™, przetwarzanie i zapamiÄ™tywanie informacji. JednÄ… z przyczyn moÅ¼e byÄ‡ aktywizacja i wspÃ³Å‚praca kilku obszarÃ³w mÃ³zgu jednoczeÅ›nie. TÅ‚umaczenie myÅ›li i koncepcji na obrazy wspiera tworzenie nowych poÅ‚Ä…czeÅ„ neuronowych, co pomaga lepiej rozumieÄ‡ i zapamiÄ™tywaÄ‡. Rysowanie odgrywa rolÄ™ we wspieraniu osÃ³b w spektrum autyzmu oraz osÃ³b z demencjÄ…. ZastosowaÅ„ dla rysowania i korzyÅ›ci z niego pÅ‚ynÄ…cych jest naprawdÄ™ mnÃ³stwo. Jest to temat rzeka, dlatego udostÄ™pniam linki do dodatkowych ÅºrÃ³deÅ‚ dla osÃ³b zainteresowanych:

  • The drawing effect: evidence for reliable and robust memory benefits in free recall

A co z cyfrowymi notatkami?â€‹

Nie odÅ¼egnujÄ™ siÄ™ od cyfrowych notatek - rÃ³wnieÅ¼ z nich korzystam. MoÅ¼na powiedzieÄ‡, Å¼e rÃ³Å¼ne rodzaje notatek wspÃ³lnie tworzÄ… coÅ› na ksztaÅ‚t ekosystemu. Notatki cyfrowe (Obsidian) potrafiÄ… siÄ™ dobrze uzupeÅ‚niaÄ‡ z odrÄ™cznymi zapiskami. ZaleÅ¼nie od sytuacji, raz wybieram rozwiÄ…zanie analogowe, a raz cyfrowe. Czasem potrzebujÄ™ przepisaÄ‡ odrÄ™czne notatki do Obsidian, Å¼eby zasiliÄ‡ mojÄ… wirtualnÄ… skarbnicÄ™ wiedzy. Gdy jestem bardzo leniwy, robiÄ™ zdjÄ™cie notatce i umieszczam jÄ… w systemie. TeÅ¼ tak moÅ¼na.

Komu mogÄ™ to poleciÄ‡â€‹

MyÅ›lÄ™, Å¼e notowanie wizualne jest dobre dla osÃ³b, ktÃ³re lubiÅ‚y rysowaÄ‡ i szukajÄ… urozmaicenia w robieniu notatek. JeÅ›li jesteÅ› wzrokowcem, a aspekt wizualny ma dla Ciebie znaczenie podczas nauki i organizacji informacji, zdecydowanie moÅ¼esz na takich notatkach skorzystaÄ‡.

Ludzie czasem hejtujÄ… na korpomowÄ™. Ja tego nie robiÄ™ i to serio, bez ironii. Korpomowa to nie jest jakaÅ› orwellowska nowomowa. Korpomowa to coÅ› bardzo przydatnego: Å¼argon.

P: ZarejestrowaÅ‚em/am siÄ™, ale nie mogÄ™ wziÄ…Ä‡ udziaÅ‚u. Co powinienem/nnam zrobiÄ‡?
O: JeÅ›li wiesz, Å¼e nie dasz rady przyjÅ›Ä‡, daj nam znaÄ‡ piszÄ…c na adres contentbytes.krk@gmail.com.

entry.title: Student insights - the Hitachi Energy and District C technical writing initiative
entry.summary: In 2023, the Technical Writing Team at
entry.content:
In 2023, the Technical Writing Team at Hitachi Energy in KrakÃ³w participated in District C, a project run by the University of North Carolina Wilmington (UNCW) to inspire the next generation of energy professionals. This project was a perfect storm of teamwork, where the Hitachi Energy employees gave the students the glimpses of the day-to-day experiences of documentation developers. The collaboration provided valuable insights into technical writing, cross-cultural teamwork, and continuous improvement, which makes this story a compelling read for those interested in education, design thinking, or professional development.

Introductionâ€‹

District C lets students explore a real-life company's business operations. They learn about the unique aspects of an industry hands-on. In the end, students offer practical advice to the given problem during a pitch meeting, often their first experience presenting a business case to stakeholders. Read the story of the collaboration between District C and Hitachi Energy in KrakÃ³w. The story is told by Andrzej, on behalf of the Technical Writing Team.

Participants brainstorming over Zoom.

The participantsâ€‹

In 2023, our Technical Writing Team consisted of four people, two of whom were new joiners. Each of us had a different set of experiences and knowledge to share. It was in our best interest to think about how to collaborate better and align our efforts.

We were happy to exchange thoughts with a group of American students of English Studies at UNCW and the Polish post-graduate students taking a technical writing course at the Vistula non-public university. The students participating in the project could interview the Technical Writing Team about our team's role at Hitachi Energy. They used design thinking principles to examine our work environment, aiming to analyze, find opportunities, gather suggestions, and present them. All of that happened under the watchful eye of Dr. Lance Cummings, an English professor who specializes in applying AI in the realm of writing. He was the originator of this unusual project.

Intricacies of technical writingâ€‹

We shared our experiences that gave the students an idea of what makes technical writing rewarding and challenging:

  • Processing high volume of information
  • Gathering insights from experts and seeking feedback
  • Building knowledge about complex products and systems developed at Hitachi Energy

Lance, Quinn, and Andrzej telling a story about the project at the soap! content conference in June 2023.

Project executionâ€‹

First, there were two rounds of Zoom meetings where information was shared.

The members of the Hitachi Energy Team explained what it is like to be a Technical Writer and why this role requires specialized expertise. Concise and clear data gave insight into the organization's daily work and critical focus areas.

Then, students reflected on what was said and came back with additional questions to dig deeper. Each student group had a specific amount of time to ask strategic questions. These were intense, focused sessions in which both sides tried to use the available time as best they could.

This exercise had already proven beneficial to the Hitachi Energy Team. We all knew the specifics of our daily operations well. Still, it was a useful exercise to describe our role to someone outside of our working environment. Explaining without relying on jargon, project names, and mental shortcuts was challenging. It helped us to reflect on our needs and better understand them by clear formulation.

The big eventâ€‹

Student groups learned what operating in a modern global corporate workplace is like. They gathered input, applied design thinking principles, identified opportunities for growth, and suggested sound solutions, which were then presented during the final pitch meeting held over Zoom.

Proud contributors of the District C initiative.

Pitch meeting is a presentation where an individual or a team presents a business idea or concept to potential investors, stakeholders, or clients to secure funding, support, or interest in the project. The presentation usually includes an overview of the product or service and the proposed solution.

Recommendationsâ€‹

Each group presented its assessment of the opportunities and provided practical recommendations. Fresh perspectives and solutions were appreciated, as they logically tied to the identified areas for improvement. At the same time, the Hitachi Energy Team offered practical feedback that was rooted in business operations, experience, and practice.

Students focused mainly on the nature of the interactions between the Technical Writers and the Subject Matter Experts (SMEs).

They then explored questions such as: "What is the most efficient way to get insights from an SME and build product knowledge?" and "Are multiple team members often asked the same questions?".

One suggestion was to invite all SMEs to a single session to get all their answers. Alternatively, this could be resolved asynchronously through Teams or a survey.

Other recommendations included:

  • Conducting dedicated workshops to get product insights
  • Incorporating short videos to distribute knowledge and information
  • Using Scrum Master's advice to optimize the collaboration between the Tech Writers and the Dev team
  • Establishing a more formalized review process

The takeawaysâ€‹

Though we have not used every recommendation, we gained a clearer picture of our needs and possibilities. The challenge allowed for the analysis of how we operate on a daily basis. It emphasized the strategic and business objectives that are key to the effectiveness of the processes we run in KrakÃ³w and the global organization.

As part of continuous improvement, we regularly reevaluate our approach to documentation process and collaboration. Even a year later, we still actively use the good ideas we picked up during the District C project.

For example, District C inspired us to try Microsoft Loop to engage multiple Subject Matter Experts quickly.

Happy participants at the Hitachi Energy Office in KrakÃ³w.

The cross-cultural collaboration aspectâ€‹

It is worth emphasizing the international nature of this project. To gain insights into this aspect, shortly after the project was completed, we met the US participants in the KrakÃ³w office and asked about their experiences.

The American view by Quinn Williams:

This program was especially helpful in understanding how different people with different backgrounds can approach business issues. We got to work with Polish students, and sharing ideas required us to keep our communication skills at the forefront. If we had not practiced effective communication, we would not have successfully conveyed some implied thoughts from our American point of view. This foundation helped us understand the importance of creating a strong team bond and interpersonal practices.

I also enjoyed experiencing the program's professional side, where we communicated with the Hitachi Energy team members. It was interesting to see where the Polish work culture differed from the American culture and where there was an overlap. I think our teams were able to use essential pieces from both sides to create an effective workflow.

We also received insights from the Polish perspective, provided by Monika DÄ…browska, a participant in the technical writing postgraduate studies at Vistula non-public university:

What I particularly liked about District C was that we could exchange our experiences regarding learning and creating projects. The Polish education system and culture lead to a general mindset somewhat contrasting that of American students.

Also, the American view of the Poles is far from what we showed during the project. Similarly, the Poles also have certain misconceptions about the Americans. These assumptions and presuppositions were discussed and challenged during our cooperation, and we found power in our variety, creativity, exchanging experiences, and understanding one another.

The Technical Writing Team was happy to meet and get to know the US participants during their visit to the KrakÃ³w office and at the soap! content conference, where we also met some of the Polish students. After the intense cooperation, bonding during that event was fun.

Conclusionâ€‹

The collaboration between Hitachi Energy and District C was a truly enlightening experience. Students gained a deeper understanding of the technical writing profession and the complexities of the energy sector. They provided valuable recommendations to improve collaboration between Technical Writers and SMEs, such as conducting dedicated workshops and using short videos for knowledge distribution.

The project also highlighted the benefits of cross-cultural collaboration, with American and Polish participants gaining insights into different work cultures and communication styles.

The Hitachi Energy Team benefited from the fresh perspectives and practical solutions provided by the students, emphasizing the importance of continuous improvement. The ongoing impact of the collaboration is evident in the continued use of some recommendations, such as using Microsoft Loop to engage multiple SMEs quickly.

We are grateful to the students willing to listen to our stories and support us, the practitioners of the obscure art of tech writing. One can always count on the students to come up with fresh ideas! They were bright, open-minded, and not burdened with presumptions. We wish you all the best!

And thank you, Dr. Cummings, for creating such a fruitful initiative â€” we really enjoyed being a part of it.

The 2024 edition and prospectsâ€‹

In 2024, District C returned to Hitachi Energy. This time, it was led by Karolina Harazim, our Internal Communications Senior Specialist, and supported by the Technical Writing Team.

Something tells us this wasn't the last time Hitachi Energy collaborated with the University of North Carolina Wilmington. Until the next time!

Additional information about District Câ€‹

The District C program at UNCW (English Studies) aims to introduce students to diverse career paths and opportunities while providing valuable real-world experience collaborating with international companies. As an English professor and a certified District C coach, Dr. Lance Cummings has been instrumental in connecting his students with the vibrant tech writing community in KrakÃ³w, Poland.

For more information about the program, visit the official District C website.

Would you be interested in participating in a similar initiative? If so, get in touch with Dr. Lance Cummings.

  • Czy to jest priorytet?

Kalendarzâ€‹

Okazuje siÄ™, Å¼e stare dobre narzÄ™dzie jakim jest kalendarz moÅ¼e nas bardzo wesprzeÄ‡ w planowaniu i organizacji pracy. Time boxing polega na blokowaniu przedziaÅ‚Ã³w czasowych na pracÄ™ gÅ‚Ä™bokÄ…, przykÅ‚adowo od 8:00 do 12:00. Natomiast praca w blokach to ustalanie blokÃ³w czasowych, ktÃ³re chcemy poÅ›wiÄ™ciÄ‡ na konkretne zadania, czyli na przykÅ‚ad:

Ale jak zaczÄ…Ä‡?â€‹

Potem robisz 5 minut przerwy, w trakcie ktÃ³rej faktycznie wstaniesz od biurka i pÃ³jdziesz zrobiÄ‡ sobie coÅ› do picia albo chwilkÄ™ siÄ™ rozciÄ…gasz. Potem kolejne 25 minut i tak na zmianÄ™. Po jakimÅ› czasie podobno wpada siÄ™ we flow i juÅ¼ nie potrzeba minutnika bo pÄ™dzisz jak szalony! ğŸ’¨

SÅ‚oÅ„ i Å¼abaâ€‹

SÄ… czasem takie zadania, ktÃ³re nas zwyczajnie przytÅ‚aczajÄ…. SÄ… ogromne i nie bardzo wiadomo jak je ugryÅºÄ‡.

Tu podobno sprawdza siÄ™ jedzenie tego sÅ‚onia po kawaÅ‚ku, czyli rozdzielenie mega zadania, na mniejsze, ktÃ³re mogÄ… stanowiÄ‡ pewne oddzielne i niezaleÅ¼ne dziaÅ‚ania, ktÃ³re moÅ¼na nawet wyestymowaÄ‡ czasowo. Prawda, Å¼e juÅ¼ raÅºniej? ğŸ˜€

A Å¼aba? No cÃ³Å¼, jeÅ›li na liÅ›cie zadaÅ„ na dziÅ› jest jakieÅ›, ktÃ³re wyjÄ…tkowo ci nie leÅ¼y, czyli ta przysÅ‚owiowa Å¼aba - zjedz jÄ… na poczÄ…tku dnia, wtedy, jak mÃ³wi klasyk, Mark Twain, juÅ¼ nic gorszego ciÄ™ nie spotka. Czyli zasadniczo - juÅ¼ bÄ™dzie z gÃ³rki.

  • Justi Sztyper: Justi zajmuje siÄ™ dokumentacjÄ… od wielu lat, dbajÄ…c o to, aby tworzone treÅ›ci byÅ‚y jak najbardziej dostÄ™pne dla uÅ¼ytkownikÃ³w. W pracy technical writera Justi najbardziej ceni sobie podejÅ›cie docs-as-code.
  • Zuzanna Szott: Projektantka, badaczka i socjoloÅ¼ka na co dzieÅ„ pracujÄ…ca w agencji projektowo-badawczej Mobee Dick. W swojej pracy wdraÅ¼a inkluzywne i dostÄ™pne rozwiÄ…zania do produktÃ³w cyfrowych, dba o neutralny i wÅ‚Ä…czajÄ…cy jÄ™zyk oraz edukuje innych o tym, jak nie dyskryminowaÄ‡ za pomocÄ… jÄ™zyka. W swojej pracy Å‚Ä…czy wymagania biznesowe i technologiczne z dbaÅ‚oÅ›ciÄ… o koÅ„cowych, rÃ³Å¼norodnych uÅ¼ytkownikÃ³w i uÅ¼ytkowniczki projektowanych produktÃ³w. ZwiÄ…zana z AGH organizatorka wydarzeÅ„ z zakresu edukacji i kultury, prywatnie zainteresowana technologiÄ…, literaturÄ… i politykÄ….

Kiedy i gdzieâ€‹

Data: 30.10.2024
Godzina: 18:00
Miejsce: GPC Global Technology Center, Lubicz 23/a, KrakÃ³w

Kilka sÅ‚Ã³w o sponsorach i partnerachâ€‹

PaÅºdziernikowe spotkanie sponsorowane jest przez GPC Global Technology Center, a partnerujÄ… nam girls.js.

GPC Global Technology Centerâ€‹

Genuine Parts Company (GPC) jest globalnym liderem dystrybucji czÄ™Å›ci samochodowych i przemysÅ‚owych. Globalne Centrum Technologii GPC w Krakowie, powstaÅ‚e w 2022 roku, peÅ‚ni rolÄ™ centrum badaÅ„ i rozwoju, wspierajÄ…c GPC w zakresie transformacji cyfrowej. InÅ¼ynierowie GCP pracujÄ… nad zaawansowanymi technologiami i rozwiÄ…zaniami usprawniajÄ…cymi dziaÅ‚alnoÅ›Ä‡ i rozwÃ³j GPC.
